parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (lit: I am sober), I am calm (vigilant), circumspect. Of uncertain affinity: to abstain from wine, i.e. be discreet.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I am awake (in the night), watch, (b) I am watchful, on the alert, vigilant. From egeiro; to keep awake, i.e. Watch.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
An opponent (at law), an adversary. From anti and dike; an opponent; specially, Satan.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From diaballo; a traducer; specially, Satan.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To roar, howl, as a beast. Middle voice of an apparently primary verb; to 'roar'.
A lion. A primary word; a 'lion'.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To seek, search for, desire, require, demand. Of uncertain affinity; to seek; specially, to worship, or to plot.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
To drink down, swallow, devour, destroy, consume. From kata and pino; to drink down, i.e. Gulp entire.
